-ProxyUsername.set_if: var str = macro("$IcingaCheckHTTPStatus_String_ProxyUsername$"); if (len(str) == 0) { return false; }; return true;

-Username.set_if: var str = macro("$IcingaCheckHTTPStatus_String_Username$"); if (len(str) == 0) { return false; }; return true;

-ThresholdInterval.set_if: var str = macro("$IcingaCheckHTTPStatus_String_ThresholdInterval$"); if (len(str) == 0) { return false; }; return true;

-ProxyServer.set_if: var str = macro("$IcingaCheckHTTPStatus_String_ProxyServer$"); if (len(str) == 0) { return false; }; return true;

-VHost.set_if: var str = macro("$IcingaCheckHTTPStatus_String_VHost$"); if (len(str) == 0) { return false; }; return true;

-C.value: try { Use-Icinga -Minimal; } catch { Write-Output 'The Icinga PowerShell Framework is either not installed on the system or not configured properly. Please check https://icinga.com/docs/windows for further details'; Write-Output 'Error:' $$($$_.Exception.Message)Components:`r`n$$( Get-Module -ListAvailable 'icinga-powershell-*' )`r`n'Module-Path:'`r`n$$($$Env:PSModulePath); exit 3; }; Exit-IcingaExecutePlugin -Command '$ifw_api_command$'

16.description: Used to specify an array of regex-match-strings to match against the content of the webrequest response.
16.caption: Content

7.description: Used to specify the URL of the host to check http as string. Use 'http://' or 'https://' to actively chose a protocol. Likewise ':80' or any other port number to specify a port, etc.
7.caption: Url

5.description: Used to specify the webrequest response time warning threshold in seconds, everything past that threshold is considered a WARNING.
5.caption: Warning

21.description:
By default the plugin will return UNKNOWN in case a connection to a webserver is not possible. By using this
flag, the result will be modified from UNKNOWN to CRITICAL
21.caption: ConnectionErrAsCrit

12.description: Used to specify a password as securestring to authenticate with. Authentication is only possible with 'https://'.Use with: -Username
12.caption: Password

10.description: Used to specify the timeout in seconds of the webrequest as integer. The default is 10 for 10 seconds.
10.caption: Timeout

2.description: Defines with which Execution Policy the PowerShell is started
2.caption: PowerShell Execution Policy

8.description: Used to specify a VHost as string.
8.caption: VHost

11.description: Used to specify a username as string to authenticate with. Authentication is only possible with 'https://'. Use with: -Password
11.caption: Username

9.description: Used to specify headers as Array. Like: -Headers 'Accept:application/json'
9.caption: Headers

14.description: Used to specify a proxy password as securestring to authenticate with. Use with: -ProxyUsername & -ProxyServer
14.caption: ProxyPassword

20.description: Adds the returned content of a website to the plugin output for debugging purpose
20.caption: AddOutputContent

15.description: Used to specify a proxy server as string to authenticate with.
15.caption: ProxyServer

23.description:
Changes the behavior of the plugin output which check states are printed:
0 (default): Only service checks/packages with state not OK will be printed
1: Only services with not OK will be printed including OK checks of affected check packages including Package config
2: Everything will be printed regardless of the check state
3: Identical to Verbose 2, but prints in addition the check package configuration e.g (All must be [OK])
23.caption: Verbosity

6.description: Used to specify the webrequest response time critical threshold in seconds, everything past that threshold is considered a CRITICAL.
6.caption: Critical

4.description: Change the value your defined threshold checks against from the current value to a collected time threshold of the Icinga for Windows daemon, as described here: https://icinga.com/docs/icinga-for-windows/latest/doc/110-Installation/06-Collect-Metrics-over-Time/ An example for this argument would be 1m or 15m which will use the average of 1m or 15m for monitoring.
4.caption: ThresholdInterval

19.description: A switch used to invert check results.
19.caption: Negate

13.description: Used to specify a proxy username as string to authenticate with. Use with: -ProxyPassword & -ProxyServer
13.caption: ProxyUsername
